game

Class Checkers.CheckersData

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Checkers.CheckersData
  • Enclosing class:
    Checkers

    private static class Checkers.CheckersData
extends java.lang.Object
    The CheckersData class is the main class that stores the data for the pieces as well as the moves.

      • pieceAt

        public int pieceAt(int row,
                   int col)
        Gets the position of the board
        Parameters:
        row - The row in which the piece is sitting at.
        col - the column in which the piece is sitting at.
        Returns:
        the board at the specified row and column.

      • getLegalMoves

        public Checkers.CheckersMove[] getLegalMoves(int player)
        This method will get all of the legal moves a player can make, it will first check if the player is not red or black, shouldn't be possible but checking it anyways, it will then see if the player is a king, it will then create a arraylist of the total moves possible and then check if the jumps are possible.
        Parameters:
        player - the player whose turn it is.
        Returns:
        null if there is no moves or a temporary board with the possible moves.

      • getLegalJumpsFrom

        public Checkers.CheckersMove[] getLegalJumpsFrom(int player,
                                                 int row,
                                                 int col)
        this will check if the player is null, again should be impossible but checking it anyways. it will then create the arraylist of moves and check if the player can jump any, it will then create an array of all the possible moves.
        Parameters:
        player - the current player.
        row - the pawn's row.
        col - the pawn's column.
        Returns:
        return an array of all the possible moves.

      • canMove

        private boolean canMove(int player,
                        int r1,
                        int c1,
                        int r2,
                        int c2)
        This method simply checks if the player can move.
        Parameters:
        player - the player making the move.
        r1 - The starting row.
        c1 - The starting column.
        r2 - The destination's row.
        c2 - the destination's column.

      • canJump

        private boolean canJump(int player,
                        int r1,
                        int c1,
                        int r2,
                        int c2,
                        int r3,
                        int c3)
        This method checks if the player can jump by running through a series of if statments and then returnign true or false depending.
        Parameters:
        player - The player making the move.
        r1 - The starting row.
        c1 - The starting column.
        r2 - The enemy pawn's row.
        c2 - the enemy pawn's column.
        r3 - The destination's row.
        c3 - The destination's column.
        Returns:
        if the player's pawn can make the jump.

      • makeMove

        Parameters:

      • makeMove

        public void makeMove(int fromRow,
                     int fromCol,
                     int toRow,
                     int toCol)
        This class makes the piece move by determining where the piece needs to go based on the move selected.
        Parameters:

        fromCol - The starting column.
        toRow - The destination's row.
        toCol - The destination's col.
